Title:
Studies on Parmulariaceae I. A phylogeny based on available
sequence data; introducing Parmulariales ord. nov., and Hemigraphaceae,
Melaspileellaceae and Stictographaceae fam. nov.
Abstract:
The family Parmulariaceae comprises three polyphyletic
genera, but with very little data in GenBank and is presently placed in
the order Asterinales. In this study we re-analyze the available
sequence data for taxa of the family and re-examine the types of
Hemigrapha, Inocyclus and Parmularia. The phylogenetic tree generated
from maximum likelihood and Bayesian analyses of combined LSU-SSU
sequence data demonstrate the relationships among Hemigrapha, Inocyclus
and Parmularia species, and the relations of Buelliella, Karschia,
Labrocarpon, Lembosia, Melaspileella, Melaspileopsis and Stictographa.
We introduce Parmulariales ord. nov. to accommodate Parmulariaceae and
the order Asterinales accommodates Asterinaceae, Asterotexaceae,
Hemigraphaceae fam. nov., Melaspileellaceae fam. nov. and
Stictographaceae fam. nov. The notes for each new order and the new
families are provided. We confirm that Asterinaceae sensu lato is
distant from Asterinaceae sensu stricto in the phylogenic analysis. The
classification presented here is provisional, as more species are needed
to re-collected and sequenced. We expect further support for our ordinal
and familial lineages, as well as further novel lineages.
